note.p: Education: Eton; King's College, Cambridge. BA (1832); MD (London)

Career: Fellow of King's College, Cambridge; studied in Hamburg, Copenhagen and Christiana; Professor of English language and literature, University of London (1839); published "The English Language" (1841); Lecturer on Forensic medicine and Materia medica, Middlesex Hospital; Assistant Physician, Middlesex Hospital; resigned from his appointments to concentrate on ethnology; published on ethnology; revised Johnson's dictionary; was granted a civil pension of Â£100 per annum
Memberships: LRCP (1842); American Ethnology Society (Honorary Member)
